intro: Lellingeria barbensis, commonly known as the Barben Island morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many vines and flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of blue or purple. It grows as a climbing vine, often found in moist, tropical environments. Its botanical features make it a notable species in the study of tropical flora.
